page.title: 01CUFFLEY VILLAGE.
page.content: Cuffley is not a small village but is not big enough to be classified as a town.Cuffley village has enough shops to keep you going, but places called Enfield,Potters Bar and Cheshunt are towns about five miles away and if you haven't got a car there are train or bus routes for you.For the elderly there is sheltered housing called Greenfields.We have three Churches the Free Church,St.Andrews and the Roman Catholic Church.We have two telephone boxes,one down Station Road and one at the Station.Station road is so named because Cuffley Station is adjacent to it.The trains go to Kings Cross, Moorgate and Hertford North.Tolmers Road is probably the longest road in Cuffley.There are lots of post boxes round Cuffley.There are two pubs,a library,ayouth centre,a clinic and a hall.It is a pleasant place to live.
